[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [Certificate Validation - High] If HTTPS is used, are certificate validation and pinning properly configured to prevent MITM attacks?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Atomic View - Critical] Is there a mechanism to ensure a consistent view of Bitcoin blockchain state across multiple sequential RPC calls, or can intermediate state changes cause inconsistencies?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Mempool Interference - Medium] Can mempool transactions affect the results of blockchain queries in ways that break assumptions about finalized state?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Multiple Functions] [RPC State - Medium] Does the Bitcoin RPC server maintain any stateful information between calls that could affect Serai's operations?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Struct: Rpc] [Connection Cleanup - Low] When an Rpc instance is dropped, are connections properly cleaned up, or can they leak?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Response Body Cleanup - Low] Is the response body fully consumed and cleaned up even on error paths?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [Error Visibility - Low] Are RPC errors properly logged for operators to detect node connectivity or consistency issues?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [Request Tracing - Low] Can RPC requests be traced for debugging consensus issues without exposing sensitive data?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: send_raw_transaction()] [Signet/Testnet - Low] Can network magic bytes differ between mainnet/testnet causing cross-network transaction broadcasts?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Pruned Node - High] Can the Bitcoin node be running in pruned mode where historical blocks are unavailable, causing get_block() to fail for old deposits?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [BIP Support - Medium] Are BIPs (Bitcoin Improvement Proposals) like BIP-141 (SegWit), BIP-341 (Taproot) properly supported in all operations?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Unwrap Safety - Medium] The serde_json::to_vec() at line 114 uses unwrap()—can this panic if the json!() macro produces non-serializable values?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Request Building Panic - Low] The hyper::Request building at line 111-118 uses unwrap()—can malformed URLs or body cause panics?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: new()] [Method Name Unwrap - Low] The split(' ').next().unwrap_or('') at line 91 could return empty string—can empty method names in expected_methods cause issues?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Deserialization Performance - Low] Can deserializing large blocks cause performance degradation that affects batch processing deadlines?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Connection Reuse - Low] Are HTTP connections properly reused through keep-alive to minimize latency?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [Network Separation - High] If Serai supports multiple Bitcoin-like networks (Bitcoin, Litecoin), can network identifier confusion cause cross-chain transaction issues?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [Address Format - Medium] Are network-specific address formats (mainnet vs testnet) properly validated to prevent cross-network confusion?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Block Weight/Size - Medium] Are block weight and size limits validated to ensure compliance with Bitcoin consensus rules?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_transaction()] [Witness Discount - Medium] Is witness data discount (SegWit) correctly applied in any fee or size calculations?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: send_raw_transaction()] [Dust Limit - Low] Can transactions with outputs below dust limit be broadcast, potentially causing economic inefficiency?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Block Timestamp Range - Medium] Can future block timestamps or past timestamp violations be detected to prevent time-based attacks?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [Median Time Past - Medium] Are relative lock times (BIP-68/112/113) properly considered when validating transactions?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_transaction()] [Script Validation - High] Does transaction retrieval include validation of script opcodes to prevent non-standard script execution assumptions?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: send_raw_transaction()] [Script Size - Medium] Are script size limits enforced to prevent relay rejection or consensus violations?
